pull.title: Control mempool persistence using a command line parameter
pull.body:
Mempool persistence was added in
3f78562df5e86a2a0a21812047fc3a7db8cee988, and is always on. This commit
introduces a command-line parameter -persistmempool, which defaults to
true. When set to false:

- mempool.dat is not loaded when the node starts.
- mempool.dat is not written when the node stops.

This was suggested in the PR that introduced mempool persistence (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8448#issuecomment-237155942 and  https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8448#issuecomment-254640482) , but wasn't implemented in the original PR. It is a pre-req for fixing #9710.

This PR also introduces tests for mempool persistence, as well as for the new command-line parameter.

events.body:
Concept ACK.

Idea: Is there any reason a user might want to load or dump but not both?

Maybe it should be a debug option... dunno.

utACK apart from the nit, seems straightforward enough.

We should indeed consider the debug/non-debug status of this option. Is it worth adding translation strings for this, or is it just for technical debugging/development purposes? Not entirely decided about this.

@luke-jr there is. I had the same idea while debugging #9810. I wanted to load the original `mempool.dat`, but not rewrite it at the exit. I solved it by copying `mempool.dat` back before the next start. And as the workaround is so simple, please let's not complicate the code with yet another option.

> And as the workaround is so simple, please let's not complicate the code with yet another option.

Agreed. So to be clear adding this option is good, but let's not add micro-management for loading/saving specifically.

tested ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9966/commits/89acdb0307bb00c41142753bcba6629136f672a0

I especially like the test and its description!

Nits addressed and squashed.

Old tip: https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/tree/pr9966.1 / https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/commit/89acdb0307bb00c41142753bcba6629136f672a0
New tip: https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/tree/pr9966.2 / https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/commit/c4e615429458f8c2159d290082940bef2fe4f263
utACK, but move the option in the help section as suggested.

Thanks @MarcoFalke . I've moved the new option to the general options section.

New tip: https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/tree/pr9966.3 / https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/commit/d22d7b0958ccd8f7ed2f34563029388e606e2550

events.message:
Control mempool persistence using a command line parameter.

Mempool persistence was added in
3f78562df5e86a2a0a21812047fc3a7db8cee988, and is always on. This commit
introduces a command-line parameter -persistmempool, which defaults to
true. When set to false:
- mempool.dat is not loaded when the node starts.
- mempool.dat is not written when the node stops.

rebased https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/tree/pr9966.3 -> https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/tree/pr9966.4

Are any reviewers able to reACK? All review comments are addressed, so this should be ready to merge.
I think that `qa/rpc-tests` no longer exists in the master.

Add tests for mempool persistence

Adds tests for mempool persistence as well as for the new
-persistmempool command line parameter.

issue.title: TODO for release notes 0.15.0
issue.body:
Whenever possible, please amend the `doc/release-notes.md` within the pull that introduces a new fancy feature or breaks compatibility.

If this is not possible, please mention the pull here, so it can be taken care of later:

* [x] RBF GUI (#9592, ...)
* [x] #9602: Remove coin age priority and free transactions
* [x] [wallet] Rescan abortability #10208 adds `abortrescan` RPC
* [x] leveldb 1.20 #10138
* [x] #9733 adds `getchaintxstats` RPC
* [x] #9966 adds `-persistmempool` option
* [x] #8952 adds query options to `listunspent` RPC
* [x] #10478 adds `bindaddr` address for peer connections to `getpeerinfo` 
* [x] #9740 makes `dumpwallet` return the full absolute path to the dumped wallet
* [x] #10400 adds `uptime` command
* [x] Move transaction combining from signrawtransaction to new RPC #10571
* [x]  Do not allow users to get keys from keypool without reserving them #10784 


<sub>Feel free to edit

The release notes are now edited on the wiki:

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/0.15.0-Release-notes

issue.title: How should -zapwallettxes interact with persistent mempool?
issue.body:
the `zapwallettxes.py` qa test is currently broken due to a syntax error:

```python
     assert_raises(JSONRPCException, self.nodes[0].gettransaction, [txid3])
     #there must be a expection because the unconfirmed wallettx0 must be gone by now
```

This doesn't actually test that the transaction is not in the wallet, because `gettransaction()` is being called incorrectly (with an array instead of a string).

Changing the test to `assert_raises(JSONRPCException, self.nodes[0].gettransaction, txid3)` causes the rpc to succeed and the test script to fail because `txid3` is still in the wallet.

This is because the mempool is now persistent and is saved to disk when bitcoind shuts down. zapwallettxes removes the unconfirmed transaction from the wallet but bitcoind will rescan the mempool.dat file on startup and add the unconfirmed transaction back into the wallet.

I've 'fixed' zapwallettxes.py in https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/tree/zapwallettxes , but the question remains: how *should* -zapwallettxes interact with persistent mempool? The use case for zapwallettxes is explained here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/3659#issuecomment-34878999 . My view is that even with zapwallettxes, bitcoind should rescan the mempool, but there should be better documentation or a warning that unconfirmed transaction in your mempool will be re-added to the wallet even if zapwallettxes is used. If you really want to remove all unconfirmed transactions from your wallet, you can delete your mempool.dat file and then restart with zapwallettxes.

issue.title: Up to CTransactionRef point back ports to do list.
issue.body:
This issue tracker is for tracking some specific back ports to get up to the final migration to `CTransactionRef` point.

Will try to continue adding more as them appear down the back porting rabbit hole. Most likely there are more PRs in-between the ones above that need to be back ported too.

Everyone is more than welcome to join this effort :) . Just pick one on the list and start doing it.

issue.title: [NET] Inv, mempool and validation improvements
issue.body:
Ending up 2020 with a large PR :).

Included a good number of performance and privacy improvements over the mempool and inv processing/sending areas + added mempool cache dump/load. 
Almost finishing with #1726 work, getting closer to 9725, and getting closer to be able to decouple the message processing thread <-> wallet and the wallet <-> GUI locks dependencies (which will be another long story.. but well, step by step).

The final goal is clear, a much faster syncing process using pivx-qt (a good speed up for pivxd as well), smoother visual navigation when big wallets are syncing, less thread synchronization issues, among all of the improvements that will be coming with the backports adaptations.

Adapted the following PRs to our sources:

#7062 —> only eb306664.
#7174 —> complete.
#7562 —> only c5d746ac.
#7594 —> complete.
#7840 —> complete.
#7997 —> complete.
#8080 —> complete
#8126 —> except e9b4780b (we don't have the mapRelay) and c2a47246 (we don't have the relay expiration vector).
bitcoin#8448 —> complete
bitcoin#8515 —> complete
bitcoin#9408 —> complete
bitcoin#9966 —> complete
bitcoin#10330 —> complete

comments.body: I'd use "save" instead of "dump" especially if this is to be an official translated option and not a debug option. Also missing a space before `(`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,89 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2014-2016 The Bitcoin Core developers

comments.body: I might be missing something, but this is not a "connection option". Also, this could be formatted as an untranslated debug option.

Good catch, Marco! It should be moved out from "Connection options" help, e.g. after the mempoolexpiry help?

I think it should be normal option, non-debug, ie. translated.
You can do else fDumpMempoolLater = false to avoid the extra GetArg("-persistmempool", DEFAULT_PERSIST_MEMPOOL) in Shutdown()
